TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . She is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant was granted a general notary licence by ORG . On DATE she was appointed as a notary to the ORG notary firm by a decision of ORG ( ORG Архангельской области , hereinafter referred to as “ the Department of Justice ” ) .

On DATE ORG licensed the applicant to open her own private notary practice . Shortly after she had opened her notary office , she was informed by ORG ( Архангельская Нотариальная Палата , hereinafter referred to as “ the Notary Chamber ” ) that she had a statutory obligation to join it . On DATE she applied for such membership , pursuant to ORG and CARDINAL of LAW , which provide that every private practising notary must be a member of a notary chamber .

The applicant submits that she was informed by the president of ORG that she was required to pay a membership entry fee of CARDINAL times the minimum reference tariff ( минимальный размер оплаты труда ) , which at the time equalled MONEY ( RUR ) / ( CARDINAL FF ) . On DATE the applicant withdrew her application for membership since she was unable to pay this sum and because she disagreed with the manner in which the fee had been established . On DATE the ORG assembly of ORG struck the applicant out of its list .

On DATE , after the applicant had resigned from membership , she received a copy of the decision of the board of ORG , dated DATE , to admit her as a member . It fixed her membership entry fee at CARDINAL times the minimum reference tariff , equal to CARDINAL RUR ( CARDINAL ORG ) to be paid in CARDINAL instalments . However , she did not reapply for membership .

On DATE ORG brought an action before ORG of LOC ( ORG городской суд PERSON , hereinafter referred to as “ the ORG ” ) for the withdrawal of the applicant ’s right to practise as a private notary because she was no longer a member .

On DATE ORG issued an interim decision by which the applicant was forbidden to exercise the profession of private notary before her case had been decided on the merits . The applicant appealed to ORG ( ORG коллегия по гражданским делам Архангельского PERSON , hereinafter referred to as “ the Regional Court ” ) claiming that ORG was not entitled to bring the action and that the relevant national legislation breached her right under LAW not to be compelled to join or to remain in an association . She also maintained that there was no valid reason for the interim decision , since LAW provided that such a decision could only be taken if there was a risk that it would be otherwise impossible to execute the final court decision in the case .

On DATE ORG quashed the interim decision on the grounds that it was insufficiently motivated and unjustified , and referred the case back to ORG . On DATE ORG adjourned the proceedings in order to submit to ORG the question of the constitutionality of the provisions of LAW relating to the obligation for a private practising notary to be a member of a notary chamber . The applicant joined the application , alleging in addition a violation of LAW which guarantees equality before the law .

On DATE ORG judge reopened the proceedings despite the fact that ORG had not yet rendered its decision . On DATE ORG suspended the applicant ’s right to act as a private notary on the basis that she was not a member of ORG and thus practised her profession in violation of the legislation in force .
The applicant appealed . In DATE ORG adjourned the proceedings awaiting the decision of ORG .

On DATE ORG , after a hearing held on DATE , ruled that compulsory membership of a notary chamber is not contrary to Articles DATE and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW . It stated , inter alia , that notary chambers perform important public law functions , which include the supervision of the exercise of private notaries’ professional duties , and the right to address a court with a request to deprive a notary of the right to practise because of a violation of the law . Having regard to these public law functions and duties , ORG found that the principle of voluntary membership could not apply to notary chambers . As regards the status of notary chambers , ORG added that they were to be considered as non - governmental organisations taking part in ORG power . Further , it ruled that membership of a notary chamber should not be subjected to conditions other than those established by law , in particular membership fees which are not foreseen by the notary legislation .
On DATE , following the ORG decision , ORG held that ORG decision of DATE was in accordance with the law and should remain unchanged .

Subsequently , ORG requested ORG to order the applicant to pay its legal costs ( MONEY ) . On DATE ORG partly granted this claim and ordered the applicant to pay the MONEY . The applicant did not lodge an appeal against that decision .

Article CARDINAL provides that in performing notary acts , notaries have equal rights and duties , irrespective of whether they are employed by ORG notary offices or in private practice . Documents authenticated by notaries are of equal legal validity . It further states that a notary engaged in private practice must be a member of a notary chamber .

According to LAW , a notary chamber is a non - profit making organisation , which is a professional association based on the compulsory membership of private practising notaries . Persons who intend to obtain a license to conduct notary acts may also be members . Notary chambers shall be formed in each republic within GPE , in an autonomous region , autonomous areas , territories and regions , and in the cities of GPE and GPE . The notary chamber shall be a corporate body and shall organise its work on the principles of self - government . It shall conduct its activities in accordance with the legislation of GPE , the republics within GPE , and its statutes . It may engage in business activities insofar as this is necessary for the performance of its statutory tasks . Its property shall not be subject to company property tax . Its statutes shall be adopted by a meeting of its members and shall be registered in accordance with the procedures prescribed for registering the statutes of public organisations .
According to LAW , the membership fees and other payments by the members of the notary chamber are fixed by the general assembly of its members .
According to LAW , the implementation of professional duties by notaries employed at ORG notary offices shall be supervised by ORG justice bodies , and by notary chambers in the private sector .
LAW provides for the equality of all before the law and courts of law , and equality of rights and liberties .
LAW CARDINAL of the LAW provides that no one may be coerced into joining any association or into membership thereof .
